resources.string:
Arithmo is a free math multi-tools for high school students. 
Equations - Functions - Linear system - Matrix 
 
• Solving equations of any degree 
 
Enter the equation with the unknown (a capital letter) and without forgetting the sign (=) then launch the process. You can enable the search for all solutions within the specified interval. The default range is -1110 to 1110. 
Examples : 
X²-5√X = 2X-2 → X = 4.0 
sin(2X) = cosX → X = 30.0 
 
• Changing from one number system to another 
 
Choose the starting arithmetic base by writing it before the number separated by a colon (:) and then choose the end base by scrolling the drop-down bar. The decimal system is the default system. 
Examples : 
2022 → 11111100110 (base 2) 
16:F3C → 3900 
 
• Conversion of length, time, mass and speed units 
 
In the dedicated form, you must enter the values ​​to be converted, specifying the source unit and the target unit. 
Examples : 
2 km → 2000.0 m 
6 m·s¯¹ → 2.5 km·h¯¹ 
 
• Matrix calculus, co-matrix and determinant 
 
In the dedicated form, enter the data (matrix A and matrix B or a scalar) then choose an operation to apply. The result is displayed in the C tab. 
Example : 
1 2    1 2 3      9 12 15 
3 7 × 4 5 6 = 19 26 33 
5 6                  29 40 51 
 
• Graphic representation of functions, derivation and integration 
 
In the dedicated form, enter the expression of f as a function of a variable (a capital letter) then launch the study of the function. 
Example : 
f(X) = X³-5X → f'(2) = 7.0 
 
• Performing ordinary scientific computing 
 
Express the result as an irreducible fraction by checking the dedicated box. 
Examples : 
1.25 → 5÷4 
3/9 → 1÷3 
 
Retrieve the last results through the variables &1, &2, &3, …, &9 and calculate the recurrence formulas. 
Example : (Fibonacci suite) 
1 → 1 
2 → 2 
&1+&2 → 3 
&1+&2 → 5 
&1+&2 → 8 
… 
 
Use the mathematical constants π and e in your equations or calculations. 
Examples : 
X/2 = π → X = 6.283185307179586 
e+2 → 4.718281828459045 
 
• Syntax of supported functions 
 
Natural logarithm (lnX) 
Exponential (expX) and Decimal Logarithm (logX) 
Cosine (cosX) and Arccosine (acosX) 
Sinus (sinX) and Arcsine (asinX) 
Tangent (tanX) and Arctangent (atanX) 
Hyperbolic cosine (coshX) 
Hyperbolic sinus (sinhX) 
Hyperbolic Tangent (tanhX) 
Power (X^Y) and Radical (Y∆X) 
Square Power (X²) and Square Root (√X) 
Division Remainder (X\Y) and Percentage (X%) 
Sum (X#) and Factorial (X!) 
Absolute value (@X or [X])
